entry.title: Vite report on Tue, 03 Oct 2023 08:03:38
entry.summary:
Tech:
- Satya Nadella Confirms, Despite Distant Second Place, Bing is Still Profitable
- Tesla Autopilot arbitration win could set legal benchmark in auto industry
- Integrating Prometheus with SAP's Enterprise Software for Kubernetes Monitoring: A Step-by-Step Guide
- Microsoft's Jaron Lanier says AI advancing without human dignity will 'undermine everything', including reality
- Elon Musk’s X Corp. faces trademark lawsuit from social media ad agency

Business:
- Taylor Swift and Beyoncé prove yet again why they're some of the world's best businesswomen
- Trump trial judge Arthur Engoron: Who is the quippy, Ivy league-educated judge deciding the fate of Trump's NY business empire?
- The US Air Force is buying a new missile as it makes plans to blast through enemy air defenses
- Taco Bell has the fastest drive-thru, and its latest tech could get customers their orders even faster
- Republicans still don’t know how to talk to young voters online
- Why The C-Suite Should Make Workforce Compliance And Risk Management A Priority
- 4 Ways Managed Service Providers Can Stabilize Labor Costs And Utilization In Healthcare
- Global Legal Weed Market Could Soar To $55 Billion In Four Years
- The cannabis industry still lacks diversity. Improving access is a joint effort

AI:
- Microsoft's Jaron Lanier says AI advancing without human dignity will 'undermine everything', including reality
- Cognitive scientists may have discovered a link between ‘Game of Thrones’ and the loneliness epidemic

Others:
- ‘An Archeology of Silence’ Exhibit at De Young Museum is ... - Post News Group
- Watch the deposition tapes of Donald Trump, Don Jr., Eric Trump, Michael Cohen, and Allen Weisselberg in the NY civil fraud case
- U.S. avoids shutdown, but prospects for boosting science funding remain dim
- In 365 Days A ‘Ring Of Fire’ Solar Eclipse Will Visit Easter Island
- No, NASA’s Asteroid Visit This Week Won’t Make Us All Billionaires
- An orca pod has been harassing and killing porpoises for decades — but they don't eat them. Scientists still don't know why.
- First Blood Test for Dozens of Hereditary Cancers Approved by FDA
- Uncovered: Cover Art from Maverick Arts Studio 2019 - 2023 by Monte Michael Moore
- Pawly Door: The Intelligent Cat Door With Prey Detection by Pawly
- Faculty and Staff Notables | October 2023 - The Den - Mercer University

Insights:
- Bing, despite being in second place, is still profitable, indicating its value in the market.
- Tesla's Autopilot arbitration win could have significant implications for the auto industry.
- The integration of Prometheus with SAP's Enterprise Software provides a step-by-step guide for Kubernetes monitoring.
- The lack of human dignity in AI advancements is a concern raised by Microsoft's Jaron Lanier.
- The cannabis industry's lack of diversity and the need for improved access are highlighted.
- The approval of the first blood test for hereditary cancers by the FDA is a significant development in healthcare.
- The potential growth of the global legal weed market to $55 billion in four years presents opportunities for the industry.
- The link between "Game of Thrones" and the loneliness epidemic, as discovered by cognitive scientists, is an interesting finding.
- The harassment and killing of porpoises by an orca pod without consumption raises questions for scientists.
- The intelligent cat door with prey detection by Pawly showcases advancements in pet technology.
- The October 2023 faculty and staff notables at Mercer University highlight notable achievements in academia.
